intro: Acinodendron ciliatum, commonly known as the silky acacia, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered leaves with fine, silky hairs. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in dense, globular inflorescences, which are typical of the Fabaceae family. Its seeds are enclosed in small, pod-like fruits that split open when mature. Acinodendron ciliatum is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions.
